result.eng: I put all the money on the horse.
result.ga: Chuir mé an t-airgead go léir ar an chapall
result.orig: Chuir mé an t-airgead go léir ar an chapall
result.html: Chuir mé an t-airgead go léir ar an chapallI put all the money on the horse.
result.ponchtml: Ċuir mé an t-airgead go léir ar an ċapallI put all the money on the horse.

result.eng: That event put and end to the night.
result.ga: Chuir an eachtra sin deireadh leis an oíche
result.orig: Chuir an eachtra sin deireadh leis an oíche
result.html: Chuir an eachtra sin deireadh leis an oícheThat event put and end to the night.
result.ponchtml: Ċuir an eaċtra sin deireaḋ leis an oíċeThat event put and end to the night.

result.eng: They put their heads togerther and said that he should be given the prize.
result.ga: Chuir siad a gcomhairlí i dteannta a chéile agus dúirt siad gurbh fhearr an duais a thabhairt dó
result.orig: Chuir siad a gcomhairlí i dteannta a chéile agus dúirt siad gurbh fhearr an duais a thabhairt dó
result.html: Chuir siad a gcomhairlí i dteannta a chéile agus dúirt siad gurbh fhearr an duais a thabhairt dóThey put their heads togerther and said that he should be given the prize.
result.ponchtml: Ċuir siad a gcoṁairlí i dteannta a ċéile agus dúirt siad gurḃ ḟearr an duais a ṫaḃairt dóThey put their heads togerther and said that he should be given the prize.

result.eng: He put a muzzle on the dog.

result.eng: He put all he had in his pocket.

result.eng: They got relief from the cold when they put their hands around the warm cups.

result.eng: They wouldn't put her in hospital without a reason.

result.eng: As part of this dirty conspiracy, the prince was put in the mad house.

result.eng: Your thumb is bleeding. Put a plaster on it, for God's sake!
